Nightingale Institute

June 29 - July 9 2020

Docklands, Melbourne



Apply Now!

The Nightingale Medical Fellowship

The Nightingale Medical Fellowship is an accelerated fellowship for talented high-school students. Selected fellows will cover a hands-on program covering clinical medicine, public health and medical technology delivered by world-class teachers and work in teams to develop and present a healthcare solution to some of Australia's top medical experts.


During the program, all fellows will receive advice from recent medical entrants and the teaching team on how to maximise their chances of getting into medicine (study scores, interviews, UCAT, GAMSAT, SJT). The program runs from Monday June 29 to Thursday July 9 (8 full days) and costs $2,500. Diversity and financial scholarships are available. Applications are due 30th of April 2020.

Medicine

Questions?


Clinical Medicine

The clinical medicine component will cover the cardiology system in Week 1 and the respiratory system in Week 2 in a lecture and workshop series. Fellows will study an integrated curriculum which covers critical anatomy, physiology, diseases and practical clinical skills, including how to complete a medical history and examination.

Public Health

The public health component will cover the Australian health system, preventative medicine, and health economics in a series of lectures and discussion seminars. Fellows will also learn how to critically think about patient journeys and doctor workflows, and work in teams to analyse and recommend improvements to hospitals.

Medical Technology

The medical technology component will cover state-of-the-art advances in medical technology, digital health and biotechnology in several workshops. Fellows will also be provided the opportunity to learn how an electrocardiogram (ECG) works by building their own ECG using embedded controllers in small teams with engineers.

Benefits

✓ Be the first amongst your peers to learn about clinical medicine in a hands-on environment.

✓ Learn about how clinical medicine, public health and medical technology interact in the healthcare industry.

✓ Explore and confirm your medical career aspirations.

✓ Receive advice from our world-class teaching staff about how to maximise your chances of getting into medicine.

✓ Learn what interviewers are looking for in medical school interviews.

✓ Build real-life experiences that make you unique to interviewers.

✓ Receive exclusive tips and tricks on how to prepare for the UCAT.

✓ Work in teams to develop and present a solution to Australia's top medical experts.

✓ Become part of the Nightingale Alumni Society, where you'll get access to tips and tricks and job opportunities.

Advisory Team

Dr. Khoa Cao

Khoa earned his medical degree with dual honours from Monash University and trained as a medical intern at Austin Health with a focus in internal medicine. He is dual training in Public Health at the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine and Medical Engineering at Stanford University on Full Scholarship as an Australian Fulbright Scholar. He has previously been a researcher at the University of Oxford and the World Health Organization, and founded an award-winning medical AI company and Australia's largest medical hackathon. He has taught medical students for 5 years, high school students for 4 years, and is an alumni of Melbourne High School.


Dr. Emily Yeung

Emily earned her medical degree with honours from Monash University and is a Medical Registrar completing her training in Internal Medicine at Monash Health, with an aim to sub-specialise in nephrology. She holds a Master of International Public Health from the University of Sydney and a Bachelor of Integrated Science from the University of British Columbia. Emily is a prolific researcher, and has worked for the World Health Organization, the International Society of Nephrology, and the Departments of Nephrology at Monash and Eastern Health. She has taught medical doctors and students for 6 years and is an alumni of Magee Secondary School in Vancouver, Canada.

The Nightingale Institute's mission is to build innovative Australian leaders capable of a world-class contribution to important and urgent societal issues at a national and global scale. The Institute was founded by a group of Australians with expertise in medicine, engineering and law; all deeply passionate about homegrown innovation.

Contact us at team@nightingale.org.au
